sentence.text: Progressive retinal atrophy (signal transduction) is the collective name of a class of hereditary retinal dystrophies in the dog and is often described as the equivalent of retinitis pigmentosa in humans.
signal transduction is characterized by visual impairment due to degeneration of the photoreceptors in the retina, usually leading to blindness.
signal transduction has been reported in dogs from more than 100 breeds and can be genetically heterogeneous both between and within breeds.

The study indicated genetic heterogeneity as the mutation was present in all signal transduction-affected individuals in one large family of Shelties, whereas some other cases in the studied Sheltie population were not associated with this rhodopsin mediated signaling pathway mutation.
